snippet: After decades of political upheaval, there is a growing consensus that the only way to arrest Nepal’s economic spiral is through elections, including one to finish the constitution.
abstract: Nepal is scheduled to hold national elections in hopes of ending decades of political upheaval and paralysis; more than a dozen political parties are boycotting vote, but there is growing consensus that the only way to arrest Nepal's economic spiral is through elections, including one to finish the constitution.
lead_paragraph: After decades of political upheaval, there is a growing consensus that the only way to arrest Nepal’s economic spiral is through elections, including one to finish the constitution.

headline.main: In Fractured Nepal, Plans for National Elections Provide a Series of Subplots
headline.print_headline: In Fractured Nepal, Plans for National Elections Provide a Series of Subplots
